docs.text: virtual reality is a topic that has almost defined its own genre .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: since 'dark city' ( 1998 ) , films about alternative universes and parallel worlds have been coming one after another .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the most popular and original of them all has been the matrix .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: all the films released after it , have been less successful .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: david cronenberg's existenz , released only a couple of months after the matrix , was accepted and even appreciated ( by some ) , but the hype was gone .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and when 'the thirteenth floor' aired this fall , it was completely overseen and ignored .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i admit that this issue has become something between tiring and annoying , feeling like eating the same meal over and over again .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it was therefore i was less than excited , when i went out to see to 'the thirteenth floor' .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , i was positively surprised by josef rusnak's latest picture .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: matrix was an entertaining thrill ride through dreams and reality , combining the best of hollywood's action and effects with an intelligent story .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: existenz was a violent , gory and unsettling journey through reality and virtual reality , ending in blood and madness .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: 'the thirteenth floor' is somewhere in between .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: instead of going after the crowds - the action audience ( like the matrix ) , or aiming at the horror fans ( like existenz ) , 'the thirteenth floor' presents a more intelligent plot , witch will provide a less entertaining and more serious experience , that the true science fiction lovers will find rewarding .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in a near future . . . on
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the thirteenth floor of a classified building , a genius scientist , hannon fuller , has created a simulated world , his personal dreamworld , where every inhabitant is a complex , selflearning program that only believes it is real .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: right after the first testing of this world , fuller ( ) is found murdered .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: douglas hall ( ) , his closest friend and business partner , immediately becomes the prime suspect and must enter through the thirteenth floor in search of the truth .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a beautiful woman ( gretchen mol ) who suddenly appears on the scene may hold the key to the mystery , which might unravel the horrifying truth about his own existence .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the first " download into simulation " is impressive .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is the creator's first visit to his world , his creation .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in order to enter this virtual universe , you have to take over someone's identity , become another person .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this is called conciseness transfer , and this is part of the tragedy in the film : people " wake up " in unknown places and strange things start happen .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they start to doubt in their own sanity .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: these innocent people pay for the mistakes of their " users " and creators with their sanity and their lives .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is a frightening reality ; the fact that all the people in the simulation ( the program links ) are living out their lives , oblivious , not knowing that they are puppets in someone's fantasy .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: with an appealing ( " blade runner " - type ) of detective story , this film presents the beauty and possibilities of virtual reality and the lurking danger that is always present .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: our modern world is metal and glass -- cold , unfriendly , impersonal .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the thirties are different -- colorful , beautiful , elegant , virile .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this contrast demonstrates a wish for change .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: virtual reality is here portrayed as a magical , enchanting power that seduces you into its endless possibilities .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: to some it is just a journey to their personal paradise , to some a personal playground -- a life without any consequences .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: for others - a way to start over and " correct " their mistakes , by living in an illusion of their past .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: virtual reality is a wizard that transforms your hopes , dreams and fantasies to life .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: at least that's how it is all beginning .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but when you're waking up from your dream , the real world seems worthless and unreal and all you can think off is returning to your personal paradise .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this , almost narcotic effect , soon turns into confusion and ultimately madness .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: some important and interesting philosophical questions are raised -- what is real ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: what is thought ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: who are we ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: if these were answered , this film would be the greatest science fiction ever made .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they are off course not answered , but posed in an intelligent manner .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the visual aspect of the film is one of the key elements , since it portrays the contrast between these computer-simulated universes .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: kirk m . petrucelli has done a marvelous job with the recreation of the thirties with its glamour , grace and color ; and setting this world in opposition to our own -- an almost caricatured recreation of the nineties .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there are some honest and decent performances by an almost unknown cast and harald klose's moody musical score that is at in right place at the right time .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a rather unusual thing about'the thirteenth floor' is the almost complete lack of special effects .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there are no cgi animated creatures , no bullets in slow motion .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this is a more philosophical approach , reminding about the european way of filmmaking .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this is off course a major disappointment to the audience that is used to endless gunfights and mutated amphibians , but the more serious science fiction buffs and 'dark city'-fans will be pleased .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this film is interesting and inspiring .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it has everything existenz doesn't , but it lacks the immediacy and intensity of the matrix .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and then there is a happy end which , like in 'dark city' , completely alienates it from the rest of the story and context .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the plot itself is not as original as the filmmakers want us to think , since they have virtually sucked out all information from the best science fiction classics , including blade runner and 'dark city' .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: with this in mind , 'the thirteenth floor' doesn't make an oscar candidate or a film that will be remembered a year from now , yet this is a beautiful , elegant and intelligent take on virtual reality .
docs.label: positive
